title: Lee Phelps
text:
Lee Phelps (born Napoleon Bonaparte Kukuck; May 15, 1893 – March 19, 1953) was an American film actor. He appeared in more than 600 films between 1917 and 1953, mainly in uncredited roles. He also appeared in three films that won the <a href="Academy%20Award">Academy Award</a> for <a href="Academy%20Award%20for%20Best%20Picture">Best Picture</a> ("<a href="Grand%20Hotel%20%281932%20film%29">Grand Hotel</a>", "<a href="You%20Can%27t%20Take%20It%20with%20You%20%28film%29">You Can't Take It with You</a>", and "<a href="Gone%20with%20the%20Wind%20%28film%29">Gone with the Wind</a>").
Phelps appeared in the 1952 episode "Outlaw's Paradise" as a judge in the <a href="Television%20syndication">syndicated</a> <a href="Western%20%28genre%29">western</a> <a href="television%20series">television series</a>, "<a href="The%20Adventures%20of%20Kit%20Carson">The Adventures of Kit Carson</a>", starring <a href="Bill%20Williams%20%28actor%29">Bill Williams</a> in the title role. He also appeared in a 1952 TV episode (#90) of "<a href="The%20Lone%20Ranger%20%28TV%20series%29">The Lone Ranger</a>".
